metadata.title: CVE-2021-47071 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:uio_hv_generic: Fix a memory leak in error handling paths If'vmbus_establish_gpadl()' fails, the (recv|send)_gpadl will not be updatedand 'hv_uio_cleanup()' in the error handling path will not be able to freethe corresponding buffer. In such a case, we need to free the bufferexplicitly.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47071` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
